Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Given that benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) unit has a large planar molecular structure by fusing a benzene with two flanking thiophenyl units and diketopyrrolopyrrole ( DPP ) , i.e. , pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione unit has a well conjugated structure with strong π-π interaction and electron - withdrawing effect , some main - chain D-A copolymers based on DPP or / and BDT units as prime building block had been designed for optoelectronic applications in both thin - film transistors and solar cells in recent years. 6 It is worthy to note that PSCs based on these copolymers with a tandem structure showed an increasing PCE of 8.62% . 2a Here we report another novel sidechain D-A conjugated copolymer ( PBDT-TDPP-S ) for highperformance PSCs , in which the BDT and thiophene units are conjugatedly formed the main chain and the di(thiophen-2yl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione ( TDPP ) units are pended onto the thiophenyl units to build the side chain by a linkage of a 2-vinylthiophenyl unit. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% . To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The resulting PBDT-TDPP-S showed good solubility in common organic solvents , such as chlorobenzene , o-dichlorobenzene , and dichloromethane ( DCM ) , but PBDT - DPP was nearly not soluble in them. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) analysis showed that PBDT-TDPP-S has a numberaverage molecular weight ( M n ) of 1.34 × 10^4 g mol^-1 with a polydispersity index of 1.27 ( Figure S1 ). Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that PBDT-TDPP-S has high thermal stability with a degradation temperature ( T d ) of 364 °C at 5% weight loss. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDT) |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP) |
| thiophene |
| 2-vinylthiophenyl |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PBDT-DPP |
| PC71BM |

Note that some of these entities are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed them once in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities that refer to "Material name" in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |

I have removed the entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name", such as "BDT" and "DPP", as they are already listed as valid Material names in the table above.

In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. To our best knowledge , the efficiency is among the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers and is twice higher than that of the main - chain D-A counterpart polymer PBDTDPP-OR in the single BHJ PSCs. synthesized by a common Stille coupling reaction using Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 as catalyst with a high yield of 78.7% , as shown in Scheme 1. For comparison , the corresponding main - chain D-A conjugated copolymer of PBDT - DPP was made at the same time. The corresponding molecular weights and thermal properties of PBDT-TDPP-S are summarized in Table 1 , and the recorded TGA curve is shown in Figure S2 ( see Supporting Information ) . The UV - vis absorption spectra of PBDT-TDPP-S in DCM solution and solid film are shown in Figure 1a.

Paragraph: 4,5 Nevertheless , most of these side - chain D-A conjugated polymers did not exhibit comparable device performance to their main - chain D-A counterpart polymers. In order to develop high - performance side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , it is necessary to develop new catalog of side - chain D-A polymers for efficient PSCs. Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of material properties in the paragraph! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4,5 | (mentioned in the phrase "4,5 Nevertheless") |
| benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDT) unit |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP) unit |
| pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione (TDPP) unit |
| number-average molecular weight (Mn) |
| polydispersity index (PDI) |
| degradation temperature (Td) |
| UV-vis absorption spectrum |

Here are the explanations for each property value:

* 4,5: This is the molecular weight of the BDT unit.
* Benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDT) unit: This is the name of a molecular structure that is used as a building block in the synthesis of the conjugated polymer.
* Diketopyrrolopyrrole (DPP) unit: This is another building block used in the synthesis of the conjugated polymer.
* Pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4(2H,5H)-dione (TDPP) unit: This is another building block used in the synthesis of the conjugated polymer.
* Number-average molecular weight (Mn): This is the average molecular weight of the conjugated polymer, calculated based on the number of molecules in the sample.
* Polydispersity index (PDI): This is a measure of the variation in the molecular weights of the conjugated polymer, calculated as the ratio of the width of the molecular weight distribution to the average molecular weight.
* Degradation temperature (Td): This is the temperature at which the conjugated polymer degrades to a significant extent, as determined by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
* UV-vis absorption spectrum: This is a graph of the absorption of light by the conjugated polymer in the UV-vis region of the spectrum.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions or need further clarification.
